required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Phase 2, Safety, Tolerability, and Efficacy Study of PD 0360324 in Chronic Pulmonary Sarcoidosis
clinical_study.official_title: A PHASE 2 RANDOMIZED, DOUBLE BLIND, PLACEBO CONTROLLED, PARALLEL GROUP, 20-WEEK SAFETY, TOLERABILITY, AND EFFICACY STUDY OF PD 0360324 IN ADULT SUBJECTS WITH CHRONIC PULMONARY SARCOIDOSIS

brief_summary.textblock: The study proposes to evaluate the safety, tolerability, and efficacy of PD 0360324 in subjects with chronic pulmonary sarcoidosis inadequately treated with standard of care therapies.

detailed_description.textblock: The trial was terminated prematurely on Mar 24, 2014 due to a business decision. The decision to terminate the trial was not based on any clinical safety or efficacy concerns.

clinical_study.why_stopped: See termination reason in detailed description.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline (Absolute) in % Predicted Forced Vital Capacity (FVC) Compared to Placebo at Week 16
primary_outcome.description: The percent predicted FVC was calculated by observed FVC/predicted FVC * 100. The predicted FVC values was calculated according to age, height, race and gender. FVC is the volume of air which can be forcibly exhaled from the lungs after taking the deepest breath possible.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Chest X-ray Global Assessment Score (5-point )
secondary_outcome.description: Digital copies of Chest x-rays performed during the study were graded according to a 5 point Likert scale: 1 = markedly worsened; 2 = worsened; 3 = unchanged; 4 = improved; and 5 = markedly improved. Baseline will be defined as the last available x-ray prior to first dose.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in FVC (Absolute ) Compared to Placebo at Weeks 2,4,8,12, 14, and 20
secondary_outcome.description: FVC is the volume of air which can be forcibly exhaled from the lungs after taking the deepest breath possible. Trough FVC was obtained from spirometry, performed before study treatment administration.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline Absolute in FVC (% Predicted) Compared to Placebo at Weeks 2,4,8,12,14, and 20
secondary_outcome.description: The percent predicted FVC was calculated by observed FVC/predicted FVC * 100. The predicted FVC values was calculated according to age, height, race and gender. FVC is the volume of air which can be forcibly exhaled from the lungs after taking the deepest breath possible.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Forced Expiratory Volume in 1 Second (FEV1) at Weeks 2,4,8,12,14, 16 and 20
secondary_outcome.description: FEV1 is the maximal volume of air exhaled in the first second of a forced expiration from a position of full inspiration. Trough FEV1 was obtained from spirometry, performed before study treatment administration.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in % Predicted FEV1 at Weeks 2,4,8,12,14, 16 and 20
secondary_outcome.description: The percent predicted FEV1 was calculated by observed FEV1/predicted FEV1 * 100. The predicted FEV1 values was calculated according to age, height, race and gender. FEV1 is the maximal volume of air exhaled in the first second of a forced expiration from a position of full inspiration.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Ratio of FEV1/FVC at Weeks 2,4,8,12,14, 16 and 20
secondary_outcome.description: FEV1 is the maximal volume of air exhaled in the first second of a forced expiration from a position of full inspiration. Trough FEV1 was obtained from spirometry, performed before study treatment administration. FVC is the volume of air which can be forcibly exhaled from the lungs after taking the deepest breath possible. Trough FVC was obtained from spirometry, performed before study treatment administration.

secondary_outcome.measure: Estimated Treatment Effect Over Placebo in FVC Averaged Over 16 Weeks
secondary_outcome.description: FVC is the volume of air which can be forcibly exhaled from the lungs after taking the deepest breath possible. Through FVC was obtained from spirometry, performed before study treatment administration.

intervention.description: 100 mg Q2W or 150 mg Q2W via intravenous infusion based on protocol determined dose escalation/de-escalation criteria; 12 weeks Active Therapy;
normal saline Q2W via intravenous infusion for 12 weeks

facility.name: Mount Sinai School Of Medicine/Mount Sinai Medical Center
The Barrett Cancer Center at UC Health

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

patient_data.ipd_description: Pfizer will provide access to individual de-identified participant data and related study documents (e.g. protocol, Statistical Analysis Plan (SAP), Clinical Study Report (CSR)) upon request from qualified researchers, and subject to certain criteria, conditions, and exceptions. Further details on Pfizer's data sharing criteria and process for requesting access can be found at: https://www.pfizer.com/science/clinical_trials/trial_data_and_results/data_requests.

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: In Part A, approximately 22 subjects were to be enrolled to receive PD 0360324 100 mg once every 2 weeks (Q2W)/150 mg Q2W. In Part B, approximately 66 subjects were planned to be enrolled to receive PD 0360324 (either 100 or 150 mg Q2W defined in Part A) B.

group.title: PD 0360324 100 mg Q2W / 150 mg Q2W
group.description: PD-0360324 100 milligram (mg) was administered as intravenous infusion on Day 1 of every 2 weeks for Week 0 and Week 2. PD-0360324 150 mg was administered as intravenous infusion on Day 1 of every 2 weeks for Weeks 4, 6, 8, 10, and 12.

group.title: PD 0360324 100 mg Q2W / 150 mg Q2W
group.description: PD-0360324 100 milligram (mg) was administered as intravenous infusion on Day 1 of every 2 weeks for Week 0 and Week 2. PD-0360324 150 mg was administered as intravenous infusion on Day 1 of every 2 weeks for Weeks 4, 6, 8, 10, and 12.

measurement_list.measurement: Standard deviation cannot be calculated for a sample size of 1.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline (Absolute) in % Predicted Forced Vital Capacity (FVC) Compared to Placebo at Week 16
outcome.description: The percent predicted FVC was calculated by observed FVC/predicted FVC * 100. The predicted FVC values was calculated according to age, height, race and gender. FVC is the volume of air which can be forcibly exhaled from the lungs after taking the deepest breath possible.
outcome.population: No subjects were analyzed due to early termination of the study and the small enrollment number.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of less than 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), less than 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Due to early termination of the study and the small enrollment number, analysis of primary and secondary pharmacodynamic endpoints could not be performed.
